body:
I am going to build a computer for the first time and I was wondering if this computer is a good build
Im looking for something for gaming and video editing
body_tagged:

title: New Computer

replies.body:
Welcome to Sulo's nerd cave, how can I help you?

But actually, the performance of your PC, in most cases, depends on your budget.

replies.body:
Here is my tip: NVIDA GeForce GTX 780 Dual graphics card (btw its an alienware... and its GOOD!) Windows 7 or 8.1, Pretty good sized Monitor (for pvp) 16GB or 8GB, 2TB HDDR, Intel core i7 4770k. Thats basically all you need-> $2,995 USD. **Alienware Aurora
 
Setup: Mouse - Razer Naga | Keyboard - Razer (Doesnt matter :P) | Mouse Pad - (Anything)

Description: Runs minecraft at 200-400 fps, shaders 60-150 fps, Optifine 250-450 fps, Good for games such as: BF4, COD, Fifa, Titanfall, etc. Hope this helped 

Btw this is a built PC :D


 *Right click the picture, then hit (Open image with new tab, to see what its like :D)

replies.body:
For the HDD, I think 1TB is enough, you can always add more in the future for a cheaper price, or you can buy an SSD.

Good, but expensive for his $750 budget :P
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: I wish I could build my own PC... #NoMoney #NoKnowledge #SadFace :(
replies.body_tagged: I wish I could build my own PC... #NoMoney #NoKnowledge #SadFace :(

replies.body:
Don't get alienware, you could build that pc for much less.
It's way too overpriced :c



I would get 1tb of hdd and get a gtx 750ti instead of a gt 740.
The 750ti scored 3622 and the gt 740 scored 1401 ->  Pass mark - G3D Mark on videocardbenchmark.net
(higher is better)
the 750ti is about 50$ more.
replies.body_tagged:
